name: Leviathan
descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) is a Chinese state-sponsored cyber espionage group that has been attributed to the Ministry of State Security's (MSS) Hainan State Security Department and an affiliated front company.(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021) Active since at least 2009, [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has targeted the following sectors: academia, aerospace/aviation, biomedical, defense industrial base, government, healthcare, manufacturing, maritime, and transportation across the US, Canada, Australia, Europe, the Middle East, and Southeast Asia.(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)(Citation: Proofpoint Leviathan Oct 2017)(Citation: FireEye Periscope March 2018)(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)

subtechniques.name: Domains
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has established domains that impersonate legitimate entities to use for targeting efforts. (Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)(Citation: Accenture MUDCARP March 2019)

subtechniques.name: Vulnerability Scanning
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has conducted reconnaissance against target networks of interest looking for vulnerable, end-of-life, or no longer maintainted devices against which to rapidly deploy exploits.(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)

technique_table_data.name: Archive Collected Data
technique_table_data.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has archived victim's data prior to exfiltration.(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)

technique_table_data.name: BITS Jobs
technique_table_data.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has used [BITSAdmin](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0190) to download additional tools.(Citation: FireEye Periscope March 2018)

subtechniques.name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has used JavaScript to create a shortcut file in the Startup folder that points to its main backdoor.(Citation: Proofpoint Leviathan Oct 2017)(Citation: FireEye Periscope March 2018)

subtechniques.name: Shortcut Modification
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has used JavaScript to create a shortcut file in the Startup folder that points to its main backdoor.(Citation: Proofpoint Leviathan Oct 2017)(Citation: FireEye Periscope March 2018)

subtechniques.name: PowerShell
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has used PowerShell for execution.(Citation: Proofpoint Leviathan Oct 2017)(Citation: FireEye Periscope March 2018)(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)(Citation: Accenture MUDCARP March 2019)

subtechniques.name: Visual Basic
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has used VBScript.(Citation: Proofpoint Leviathan Oct 2017)

subtechniques.name: Social Media Accounts
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has compromised social media accounts to conduct social engineering attacks.(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)

subtechniques.name: Email Accounts
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has compromised email accounts to conduct social engineering attacks.(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)

subtechniques.name: Server
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has used compromised legitimate websites as command and control nodes for operations.(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)

subtechniques.name: Network Devices
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has used compromised networking devices, such as small office/home office (SOHO) devices, as operational command and control infrastructure.(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)

technique_table_data.name: Data from Information Repositories
technique_table_data.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) gathered information from SQL servers and Building Management System (BMS) servers during [Leviathan Australian Intrusions](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0049).(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)

subtechniques.name: Local Data Staging
subtechniques.descr:
[Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has used C:\Windows\Debug and C:\Perflogs as staging directories.(Citation: FireEye Periscope March 2018)(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)
[Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) stored captured credential material on local log files on victim systems during [Leviathan Australian Intrusions](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0049).(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)

subtechniques.name: Remote Data Staging
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has staged data remotely prior to exfiltration.(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)

technique_table_data.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
technique_table_data.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has used a DLL known as SeDll to decrypt and execute other JavaScript backdoors.(Citation: Proofpoint Leviathan Oct 2017)

subtechniques.name: Exploits
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has rapidly transformed and adapted public exploit proof-of-concept code for new vulnerabilities and utilized them against target networks.(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)

technique_table_data.name: Domain Trust Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) performed Active Directory enumeration of victim environments during [Leviathan Australian Intrusions](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0049).(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)

technique_table_data.name: Drive-by Compromise
technique_table_data.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has infected victims using watering holes.(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)

subtechniques.name: Social Media Accounts
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has created new social media accounts for targeting efforts.(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)

subtechniques.name: Email Accounts
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has created new email accounts for targeting efforts.(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)

subtechniques.name: Windows Management Instrumentation Event Subscription
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has used WMI for persistence.(Citation: FireEye Periscope March 2018)

technique_table_data.name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
technique_table_data.descr:
[Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has exfiltrated data over its C2 channel.(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)
[Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) exfiltrated collected data over existing command and control channels during [Leviathan Australian Intrusions](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0049).(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)

subtechniques.name: Exfiltration to Cloud Storage
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has used an uploader known as LUNCHMONEY that can exfiltrate files to Dropbox.(Citation: Proofpoint Leviathan Oct 2017)(Citation: FireEye Periscope March 2018)

technique_table_data.name: Exploit Public-Facing Application
technique_table_data.descr:
[Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has used exploits against publicly-disclosed vulnerabilities for initial access into victim networks.(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)
[Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) exploited public-facing web applications and appliances for initial access during [Leviathan Australian Intrusions](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0049).(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)

technique_table_data.name: Exploitation for Client Execution
technique_table_data.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has exploited multiple Microsoft Office and .NET vulnerabilities for execution, including CVE-2017-0199, CVE-2017-8759, and CVE-2017-11882.(Citation: Proofpoint Leviathan Oct 2017)(Citation: FireEye Periscope March 2018)(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)(Citation: Accenture MUDCARP March 2019)

technique_table_data.name: Exploitation for Credential Access
technique_table_data.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) exploited vulnerable network appliances during [Leviathan Australian Intrusions](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0049), leading to the collection and exfiltration of valid credentials.(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)

technique_table_data.name: Exploitation for Privilege Escalation
technique_table_data.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) exploited software vulnerabilities in victim environments to escalate privileges during [Leviathan Australian Intrusions](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0049).(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)

technique_table_data.name: External Remote Services
technique_table_data.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has used external remote services such as virtual private networks (VPN) to gain initial access.(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)

subtechniques.name: Credentials
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has collected compromised credentials to use for targeting efforts.(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)

technique_table_data.name: Group Policy Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) performed extensive Active Directory enumeration of victim environments during [Leviathan Australian Intrusions](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0049).(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)

subtechniques.name: Disable or Modify System Firewall
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) modified system firewalls to add two open listening ports on 9998 and 9999 during [Leviathan Australian Intrusions](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0049).(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)

technique_table_data.name: Ingress Tool Transfer
technique_table_data.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has downloaded additional scripts and files from adversary-controlled servers.(Citation: Proofpoint Leviathan Oct 2017)(Citation: FireEye Periscope March 2018)

technique_table_data.name: Input Capture
technique_table_data.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) captured submitted multfactor authentication codes and other technical artifacts related to remote access sessions during [Leviathan Australian Intrusions](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0049).(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)

subtechniques.name: Dynamic Data Exchange
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has utilized OLE as a method to insert malicious content inside various phishing documents. (Citation: Accenture MUDCARP March 2019)

technique_table_data.name: Internal Spearphishing
technique_table_data.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has conducted internal spearphishing within the victim's environment for lateral movement.(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)

technique_table_data.name: Multi-Factor Authentication Interception
technique_table_data.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) abused compromised appliance access to collect multifactor authentication token values during [Leviathan Australian Intrusions](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0049).(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)

technique_table_data.name: Network Share Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) scanned and enumerated remote network shares in victim environments during [Leviathan Australian Intrusions](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0049).(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)

subtechniques.name: Binary Padding
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has inserted garbage characters into code, presumably to avoid anti-virus detection.(Citation: Proofpoint Leviathan Oct 2017)

subtechniques.name: Steganography
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has used steganography to hide stolen data inside other files stored on Github.(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)

subtechniques.name: Encrypted/Encoded File
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has obfuscated code using base64.(Citation: Proofpoint Leviathan Oct 2017)

subtechniques.name: Compression
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has obfuscated code using gzip compression.(Citation: Proofpoint Leviathan Oct 2017)

subtechniques.name: Vulnerabilities
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) weaponized publicly-known vulnerabilities for initial access and other purposes during [Leviathan Australian Intrusions](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0049).(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)

technique_table_data.name: OS Credential Dumping

subtechniques.name: LSASS Memory
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has used publicly available tools to dump password hashes, including ProcDump and WCE.(Citation: FireEye APT40 March 2019)

technique_table_data.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has used publicly available tools to dump password hashes, including [HOMEFRY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0232).(Citation: FireEye APT40 March 2019)

subtechniques.name: Spearphishing Attachment
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has sent spearphishing emails with malicious attachments, including .rtf, .doc, and .xls files.(Citation: Proofpoint Leviathan Oct 2017)(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)

subtechniques.name: Spearphishing Link
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has sent spearphishing emails with links, often using a fraudulent lookalike domain and stolen branding.(Citation: Proofpoint Leviathan Oct 2017)(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)

subtechniques.name: Dynamic-link Library Injection
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has utilized techniques like reflective DLL loading to write a DLL into memory and load a shell that provides backdoor access to the victim.(Citation: Accenture MUDCARP March 2019)

technique_table_data.name: Protocol Tunneling
technique_table_data.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has used protocol tunneling to further conceal C2 communications and infrastructure.(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)

subtechniques.name: Multi-hop Proxy
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has used multi-hop proxies to disguise the source of their malicious traffic.(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)

subtechniques.name: Remote Desktop Protocol
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has targeted RDP credentials and used it to move through the victim environment.(Citation: FireEye APT40 March 2019)

subtechniques.name: SMB/Windows Admin Shares
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) used remote shares to move laterally through victim networks during [Leviathan Australian Intrusions](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0049).(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)

subtechniques.name: SSH
subtechniques.descr:
[Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) used ssh for internal reconnaissance.(Citation: FireEye APT40 March 2019)
[Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) used SSH brute force techniques to move laterally within victim environments during [Leviathan Australian Intrusions](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0049).(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)

technique_table_data.name: Remote System Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) performed extensive remote host enumeration to build their own map of victim networks during [Leviathan Australian Intrusions](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0049).(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)

technique_table_data.name: Search Victim-Owned Websites
technique_table_data.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) enumerated compromised web application resources to identify additional endpoints and resources linkd to the website for follow-on access during [Leviathan Australian Intrusions](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0049).(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)

subtechniques.name: Web Shell
subtechniques.descr:
[Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) relies on web shells for an initial foothold as well as persistence into the victim's systems.(Citation: FireEye APT40 March 2019)(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)
[Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) relied extensively on web shell use following initial access for persistence and command execution purposes in victim environments during [Leviathan Australian Intrusions](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0049).(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)

technique_table_data.name: Steal Application Access Token
technique_table_data.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) abused access to compromised appliances to collect JSON Web Tokens (JWTs), used for creating virtual desktop sessions, during [Leviathan Australian Intrusions](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0049).(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)

subtechniques.name: Kerberoasting
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) used Kerberoasting techniques during [Leviathan Australian Intrusions](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0049).(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)

subtechniques.name: Code Signing
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has used stolen code signing certificates to sign malware.(Citation: FireEye Periscope March 2018)(Citation: FireEye APT40 March 2019)

subtechniques.name: Regsvr32
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has used regsvr32 for execution.(Citation: Proofpoint Leviathan Oct 2017)

technique_table_data.name: System Information Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) performed host enumeration and data gathering operations on victim machines during [Leviathan Australian Intrusions](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0049).(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)

technique_table_data.name: Unsecured Credentials
technique_table_data.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) gathered credentials hardcoded in binaries located on victim devices during [Leviathan Australian Intrusions](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0049).(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)

subtechniques.name: Credentials In Files
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) gathered credentials stored in files related to Building Management System (BMS) operations during [Leviathan Australian Intrusions](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0049).(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)

subtechniques.name: Malicious Link
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has sent spearphishing email links attempting to get a user to click.(Citation: Proofpoint Leviathan Oct 2017)(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)

subtechniques.name: Malicious File
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has sent spearphishing attachments attempting to get a user to click.(Citation: Proofpoint Leviathan Oct 2017)(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)

technique_table_data.name: Valid Accounts
technique_table_data.descr:
[Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has obtained valid accounts to gain initial access.(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)(Citation: Accenture MUDCARP March 2019)(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)
[Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) used captured, valid account information to log into victim web applications and appliances during [Leviathan Australian Intrusions](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0049).(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)

subtechniques.name: Domain Accounts
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) compromised domain credentials during [Leviathan Australian Intrusions](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0049).(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)

subtechniques.name: Local Accounts
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) used captured local account information, such as service accounts, for actions during [Leviathan Australian Intrusions](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0049).(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)

subtechniques.name: One-Way Communication
subtechniques.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has received C2 instructions from user profiles created on legitimate websites such as Github and TechNet.(Citation: FireEye Periscope March 2018)

technique_table_data.name: Windows Management Instrumentation
technique_table_data.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has used WMI for execution.(Citation: Proofpoint Leviathan Oct 2017)

campaign_data.name: Leviathan Australian Intrusions
campaign_data.desc: [Leviathan Australian Intrusions](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0049) was conducted by the [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) threat actor.(Citation: CISA Leviathan 2024)

software_data.name: BADFLICK
software_data.descr: (Citation: FireEye Periscope March 2018)(Citation: Accenture MUDCARP March 2019)

software_data.name: China Chopper
software_data.descr: (Citation: FireEye Periscope March 2018)(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)(Citation: Accenture MUDCARP March 2019)

software_data.name: Cobalt Strike
software_data.descr: (Citation: Proofpoint Leviathan Oct 2017)(Citation: FireEye Periscope March 2018)(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)

software_data.name: Derusbi
software_data.descr: (Citation: FireEye Periscope March 2018)(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)

techniques.name: Hijack Execution Flow
techniques.sub_name: Path Interception by Search Order Hijacking

techniques.name: Hijack Execution Flow
techniques.sub_name: Path Interception by PATH Environment Variable

software_data.name: MURKYTOP
software_data.descr: (Citation: FireEye Periscope March 2018)(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)

software_data.name: NanHaiShu
software_data.descr: (Citation: Proofpoint Leviathan Oct 2017)(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)

software_data.name: Orz
software_data.descr: (Citation: Proofpoint Leviathan Oct 2017)(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)(Citation: Accenture MUDCARP March 2019)

techniques.name: Hijack Execution Flow
techniques.sub_name: Path Interception by PATH Environment Variable

techniques.name: Hijack Execution Flow
techniques.sub_name: Path Interception by Search Order Hijacking

alias_descriptions.name: MUDCARP
alias_descriptions.descr: (Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)(Citation: Accenture MUDCARP March 2019)

alias_descriptions.name: Kryptonite Panda
alias_descriptions.descr: (Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)(Citation: Crowdstrike KRYPTONITE PANDA August 2018)

alias_descriptions.name: Gadolinium
alias_descriptions.descr: (Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)(Citation: MSTIC GADOLINIUM September 2020)

alias_descriptions.name: BRONZE MOHAWK
alias_descriptions.descr: (Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)(Citation: SecureWorks BRONZE MOHAWK n.d.)

alias_descriptions.name: TEMP.Jumper
alias_descriptions.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) was previously reported upon by FireEye as TEMP.Periscope and TEMP.Jumper.(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)(Citation: FireEye APT40 March 2019)

alias_descriptions.name: APT40
alias_descriptions.descr: FireEye reporting on TEMP.Periscope (which was combined into APT40) indicated TEMP.Periscope was reported upon as Leviathan.(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)(Citation: Proofpoint Leviathan Oct 2017)(Citation: FireEye Periscope March 2018)(Citation: FireEye APT40 March 2019)

alias_descriptions.name: TEMP.Periscope
alias_descriptions.descr: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) was previously reported upon by FireEye as TEMP.Periscope and TEMP.Jumper.(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)(Citation: FireEye Periscope March 2018)(Citation: FireEye APT40 March 2019)

Accenture MUDCARP March 2019.description: Accenture iDefense Unit. (2019, March 5). Mudcarp's Focus on Submarine Technologies. Retrieved August 24, 2021.

Crowdstrike KRYPTONITE PANDA August 2018.description: Adam Kozy. (2018, August 30). Two Birds, One Stone Panda. Retrieved August 24, 2021.

Proofpoint Leviathan Oct 2017.description: Axel F, Pierre T. (2017, October 16). Leviathan: Espionage actor spearphishes maritime and defense targets. Retrieved February 15, 2018.

MSTIC GADOLINIUM September 2020.description: Ben Koehl, Joe Hannon. (2020, September 24). Microsoft Security - Detecting Empires in the Cloud. Retrieved August 24, 2021.

CISA Leviathan 2024.description: CISA et al. (2024, July 8). People’s Republic of China (PRC) Ministry of State Security APT40 Tradecraft in Action. Retrieved February 3, 2025.

CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021.description: CISA. (2021, July 19). (AA21-200A) Joint Cybersecurity Advisory – Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures of Indicted APT40 Actors Associated with China’s MSS Hainan State Security Department. Retrieved August 12, 2021.

FireEye Periscope March 2018.description: FireEye. (2018, March 16). Suspected Chinese Cyber Espionage Group (TEMP.Periscope) Targeting U.S. Engineering and Maritime Industries. Retrieved April 11, 2018.

Microsoft Threat Actor Naming July 2023.description: Microsoft . (2023, July 12). How Microsoft names threat actors. Retrieved November 17, 2023.

FireEye APT40 March 2019.description: Plan, F., et al. (2019, March 4). APT40: Examining a China-Nexus Espionage Actor. Retrieved March 18, 2019.

SecureWorks BRONZE MOHAWK n.d..description: SecureWorks. (n.d.). Threat Profile - BRONZE MOHAWK. Retrieved August 24, 2021.
